title: Teen girl ‘sawed sausage dog's legs off' and then claimed they'd just 'fallen off'
text:

A 17-year-old girl sawed a dachshund's legs off and then claimed they had just fallen off, it has been reported.

The unnamed teen, her 50-year-old mother and a 17-year-old friend did not seek treatment for the dog after he was allegedly shot in February 2019.

The animal, named Buddy by rescuers, was left paralysed after the incident and walked with his legs dragged behind him, which resulted in sores, officials said.

It is believed the trio, from Slidell in Louisiana, attempted some amateur surgery on the helpless pet.

When the two-year-old dog was found in the pouring rain by an animal rescue group, his finders noticed Buddy was missing both his hind legs.

They posted an announcement to look for the pet's owner, but nobody came forward.

(Image: Facebook)

Deputies from St. Tammany Parish Sheriff's Office were alerted on September 25 by a local resident and visited the trailer park where he lived.

The dog's owners tried to claim Buddy's legs had simply fallen off from being bandaged too tightly following the shooting.

However, detectives consulted with a veterinarian, who concluded that the wounds on the dog’s hind legs were "maliciously inflicted" and not removed by a veterinary professional nor by natural means, deputies said.

(Image: Facebook)

St. Tammany Parish Sheriff Randy Smith said: "As a dog owner myself, I was completely appalled when we received a complaint of such horrific animal cruelty in our community.

"Our investigators acted swiftly, and the parties responsible have been charged accordingly."

The 17-year-old daughter was charged with aggravated animal cruelty and booked into Florida Parishes Juvenile Detention Centre on Monday September 30.

The teen's mother was charged with a less serious animal cruelty charge and released on a summons.

(Image: Facebook)

The other teenager was also arrested for animal cruelty and released into the custody of a relative after admitting that she abandoned the dog in the mobile home park where he was found, according to New York Post .

Buddy is now receiving intensive care and is said to be doing well, Metro reports.

A Facebook page was set up top help pay for his medical bills and over £19,800 have been raised so far.

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

On Tuesday, it was reported that the dog had a "bone sticking out and an infection setting in".

"Due to blood loss he had to have a blood transfusion [sic] today in order to survive," the fundraiser read.

"His wounds were cleaned, He had an IV and urinary catheter placed and is now on IV antibiotics and pain meds until his values come up enough to survive surgery. His Xrays also show he has 2 bullets near his back."

The pet will undergo surgery on Monday to remove the exposed bone, after which he will be able to use a wheelchair.

(Image: Facebook)

A Facebook user wrote: "Praying for sweet Buddy. You deserve happiness for the rest of your days."

Another person commented: "Donated a few dollars for you buddy. Praying you make a full recovery and find the perfect family that gives you nothing but love the rest of your life!"

Anyone with information related to this incident is urged to contact the St. Tammany Parish Sheriff’s Office at 985-898-2338 or St. Tammany Parish Animal Services at 985-809-0183.
description: Little Buddy will undergo surgery on Monday and will be fitted for a wheelchair after some 'amateur surgery' from 17-year-old
